Submodules

jdxi_editor.ui.editors.config module

Configuration of Editor classes for the JDXI Editor.

Stores -Title: The title of the editor. -Editor Class: The class that implements the editor functionality. -Synth Type: Optional type of synthesizer associated with the editor. -MIDI Channel: Optional MIDI channel for the editor. -icon: Icon for the editor, represented as a string. -Keyword Arguments: Additional parameters for the editor.

Example usage: “arpeggio”: EditorConfig(

title=”Arpeggiator”, editor_class=ArpeggioEditor, icon=”ph.music-notes-simple-bold”

),

class jdxi_editor.ui.editors.config.EditorConfig(title: str, editor_class: jdxi_editor.ui.editors.synth.base.SynthBase, synth_type: Optional[Any] = None, midi_channel: Optional[Any] = None, kwargs: Dict[str, Any] = <factory>, icon: str = '')[source]

Bases: object

title: str[source]
editor_class: SynthBase[source]
synth_type: Any | None = None[source]
midi_channel: Any | None = None[source]
kwargs: Dict[str, Any][source]
icon: str = ''[source]

jdxi_editor.ui.editors.main module

JD-Xi Editor UI setup.

This class defines the main user interface for the JD-Xi Editor application, inheriting from QMainWindow. Key Features: - Initializes the main window with a tabbed editor interface.

- __init__

Initializes the UI adds elements and sets up the main layout.

- _close_editor_tab

Handles the closing of editor tabs.

class jdxi_editor.ui.editors.main.MainEditor(parent: QMainWindow | None = None)[source]

Bases: QMainWindow

JD-Xi UI setup, with as little as possible functionality, which is to be super-classed

__init__(parent: QMainWindow | None = None)[source]

Constructor for the MainEditor class. Initializes the main layout and sets up the editor tab widget.

Parameters:

parent – JDXiInstrument

closeEvent(event)[source]

close the editor tab widget, but dont delete it

Parameters:

event – QEvent
